column4: come on, someone has to know how ubuntu handles its startup programs
what now? ;)
im trying to find out if dbus is starting on boot
it should. I've seen it. ;) Hold on.
dmesg doesn't seem to capture it. ps -A|grep dbus should tell you  ?
its not starting...
because i have to start it manually when i get into gnome
it causes hald to not start as well
try sudo update-rc.d dbus default
what happens when you sudo /etc/init.d/dbus restart
everything goes ok
but on boot it fails to intialize hald
complaing about dbus not there or something
forget the exact error message
what does sudo /etc/init.d/hald restart say now?
there is not /etc/init.d/hald
its /usr/sbin/hald
/etc/init.d/dbus brings up hald
I don't know what to do. Sorry. :)
maybe i fixed it somehow... ill try a restart
ok
